name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Augusta Civic Center Inn

reviews.text: Got in late , nobody at the front desk but sign said they would be back shortly. 5min later he showed up and was not very pleasant, bad day? I do not know what the + means at this former Holiday Inn but they do not offer free breakfast like most Best Western's we stay at. Special of 95.00 tax in was nothing special. Convenient location off highway and shopping.
reviews.title: Lower average

reviews.text: Excellent hotel. It is very clean and the people that work there are very friendly and professional.
reviews.title: Survey

reviews.text: This was my 5th or 6th stay in this hotel with as much as one year between visits. The staff recognized me and treated me as a lost friend returning. Great staff!! Courteous, friendly, considerate, concerned, and helpful. Great huggers!! Always have fresh coffee available. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Staff are alert to your needs and preferences.
reviews.title: Coming home!!!

reviews.text: Better be cautious or they will make you a member of their family!!
reviews.title: outstanding service

reviews.text: Very convenient to I-95, shopping, good restaurants, and an Italian sandwich shop (Don't get those in Georgia)!!
reviews.title: "Look no further."

reviews.text: I stay in Augusta once a week, on average, and recently "found" the Civic Center Inn. I am so pleased. The front desk staff (particularly "Mark") are friendly, courteous and helpful. I always get the room I want; check-in is quick and efficient. The hotel is clean and well cared for; it always smells clean, it is quiet, the beds are comfortable, the TVs are updated. The restaurant is decent. The work out room is small but in good shape, with water, towels and TV. The hotel is a quick easy on/easy off the highway. I recommend this hotel, especially for the price! Now I'm looking forward to the opening of the outdoor pool! Please hurry!
reviews.title: Best Western Civic Center Inn

reviews.text: I've stayed here many times in the last 11 years. In 2001 this was a Holiday Inn in relatively good shape, but over the 8 or 9 years subsequent to that nothing was ever done and it deteriorated to the point that Holiday Inn came in and pulled the franchise. From what I understand an investment company came along and bought the property (along with their sister property, the Best Western in Waterville that used to be a Holiday Inn as well). They have done a pretty decent job renovating this place in the last year or so, changing out carpets, wallcoverings, light fixtures, mattresses, replacing the old tube TV's with 32" LCD's, and so forth. The staff is pleasant at the rooms are clean. Aside from the ridiculously overpriced Fairfield Inn down the road, this is probably the best option in Augusta.
reviews.title: About as good as it gets in Augusta, Maine.

reviews.text: Staff is friendly always willing to help they go above and beyond my expectations. Hotel is located right off the highway. They have menu's of local food delivery which is great. Rooms are clean comfortable and quiet.
reviews.title: Great Staff Convient Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel on my wedding night. We arrived around midnight, and left at 10 am so we weren't there long. We just needed a place to sleep before we left for our honeymoon. The check in was quick. The only weird thing was I called ahead and told them it was our wedding night and they said something special would be in the room. (I know it's a Best Western, but still) Not only was there nothing in the room, but I showed up in an ornate wedding dress and the check in guy said nothing to us. He was actually fairly rude.
reviews.title: Good for one night stay

reviews.text: The room was spotless, the bed was comfy, and there was a tv. Basic hotel room. We were bummed that a 3 star property had no indoor pool. If there had been a pool, and check in was nicer, this would be a five out of five.
reviews.title: Visit to the Best Western Plus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy off-on access from I-95. Staff here is welcoming and friendly. We had a free night at a Best Western of our choice after staying at five other BW while driving cross country. (Great promotion.) The room was fresh and well appointed with plenty of room to move around: flat screen television and free wi-fi, plus a free newspaper as an extra. The bathroom was clean and looked freshly redone. Decor was clean without a lot of frou-frou flowers everywhere. We had a quiet room facing the pool and garden area. Indoor hall access.
reviews.title: Ideal spot next to the Civic Center & Malls

reviews.text: only stay at best western chain. haven't stayed here before so thought we'd try it. nice and clean hotel. staff is excellent. restaurant on site. really good food.. got a welcome bag at check in. contained water crackers candy and chocolate. for breakfast a take out bag with water muffin kashi bar and an apple. right off the highway and across the street from a mall.
reviews.title: great find

reviews.text: I stayed here when I attended a convention at the Augusta Civic Center. Rooms are spacious, very nice. Staff is very friendly and helpful. During my stay, a fire alarm sounded and they made sure everyone moved safely outside. It turned out a fire in a trash can outside set off the smoke alarm inside the hotel.

reviews.title: Met all our needs

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the hotel in July 2012. Located just off Interstate 95 (Exit 112), the hotel was formerly a Holiday Inn property and it is apparent that under its new title, the hotel has experienced some recent refurbishments. Unfortunately, these updates don't hide the hotel's age entirely; the outdoor pool area is in need of some attention to bring it away from the feeling of a 1980s hotel. The rooms are in very good shape and high marks can be rewarded for the upgrades to the bathrooms (bright, clean and new!). The bed provides a comfortable sleep with renewed linen (duvet) and a nice mattress (I might suggest new pillows). The room's temperature controls are accessible and easy to understand; the air-conditioning was wonderful! Rooms are equipped with a small fridge and microwave, as well as the usually amenities (hair dryer, iron & board). Overall cleanliness of the room and facilities was very good and the staff onsite (both front desk and housekeeping) were very, very pleasant. Further kudos on the upgrades to the fitness center and the business center. One thing that struck me as odd was the layout of the hotel; much of the guest traffic seems to go through a side entrance, far from the lobby and there is no elevator near the lobby itself. Located a few hundred yards from the Civic Center, the hotel is in close proximity to shopping such as Wal-mart, Old Navy and Kohls (addition shopping is located just a short drive south off Exit 113 - Target, Sears, Lowes. However, apart from shopping and the few attractions of being a State Capital (State Library, Archives and Museum), I don't find much of an attraction with Augusta itself. And the lack of an indoor pool facility certain makes the choice of returning during the winter months easier. All-in-all, the hotel rate is fair and the property is clean.
reviews.title: Adequate Accommodations at BW+

reviews.text: We stayed here one night on a recent road trip. The hotel is conveniently located, and the restaurant on site is a great place for a yummy pizza and some cold beer. Note the hotel does not serve breakfast, only provides a bag with water, muffin, apple and granola bar. The pool was great to cool off in, but be careful not to jump in: it's only 4' deep throughout!
reviews.title: Convenient, but they have no family-friendly rooms with 2 Queen beds!

aka: Best Western Plus Civic Hotel Augusta
description: Conveniently located adjacent to the Augusta Civic Center, 1/2 mile from I-95 and within three miles of the Augusta State Airport and the State of Maine Capital. If you're looking to get away from it all, this pet friendly hotel’s location in the heart of Central Maine makes us an affordable and convenient starting point for hiking, biking, or ATVing adventures. In addition, our location offers ample camping or fishing outings and a myriad of other Fall activities! Want to check out some Maine Lakes during peak foliage season? There are plenty of lakes and ponds nearby ripe with opportunities for boating, fishing, foliage tours, or even charter fishing! The Belgrade Lakes region is just a short drive away and is filled with scenic fall beauty! For a top of the line golfing experience check out the Belgrade Lakes Country Club or the Augusta Country Club!Feel like eating some fresh, local fruit? Indulge in some apples from local orchards right in our lobby or pick your own at Lakeside Orchards located less than 10 miles away! Maine's largest open-air shopping center, The Marketplace at Augusta, is located just across the street! There are antiquing opportunities in nearby Hallowell, and the Freeport outlets are just 40 minutes away. Old Fort Western and the Maine State Museum are sure to provide hours of enjoyment. Leading health care providers such as Maine General Hospital, the Togus VA, and the new Harold Alfond Center for Cancer Care are just a short drive from the hotel. Enjoy our free hot continental breakfast as well as in room refrigerators and microwaves! Need to de-stress after a long day? Burn up some calories in our onsite fitness center well equipped with an elliptical, two treadmills, stationary bike, universal machine, free weights and more!
